title: Giant Hornets of Japan
abstractText:
During the past three years Dr Martin has delivered a multi-media show, using games, photographs, video clips and exhibits to explain the fascinating biology of the Japanese giant hornet. This activity is used to help explain the concepts of co-operative and selfish behaviours to adults and children. Each year the show was presented to approximately five schools with audience sizes ranging from 10 (eg workshop in a special needs school) up to 300+ where the entire school attends. Demand for the show has increase over the years.

The grant provided follow up materials for teachers eg a colourful poster illustrating the life cycle and fascinating facts about hornets and some mounted hornet specimens in a small display case so allowing teachers to have there own follow up workshops after the talks.
